name: 2,5-dimethoxybenzeneboronic acid
Reason: 2,5-dimethoxybenzeneboronic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The methoxy groups in this compound increase the melting point due to their ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 °C for each methoxy group. The boronic acid moiety also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +5 °C. The overall effect of these structural components is estimated to be around +15 °C.
